intro: Rubus × tunelensis, commonly known as the blackberry bramble, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, typical of many Rubus species. The plant produces aggregate fruits, which are commonly referred to as blackberries, and are known for their sweet-tart flavor. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in hedgerows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental and culinary value, it is cultivated in gardens and for commercial fruit production.
